com.taursys.model
Class DefaultCheckboxModel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.taursys.model.DefaultTextModel
        |
        +--com.taursys.model.DefaultCheckboxModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, CheckboxModel, java.util.EventListener, TextModel
public class DefaultCheckboxModel
extends DefaultTextModel
implements CheckboxModel

DefaultCheckboxModel is a model which holds a selected/unselected state. The two properties, selectedValue and unselectedValue, indicate the text values for the two states. They provide the value that will be stored in the model as its text value to indicate the state.

When the setSelected method is invoked with a true, then the selectedValue will be stored as the text value for the control. When the setSelected method is invoked with a false, then the unselectedValue will be stored as the text value for the control.

If the setText method is invoked directly, the value passed to it must be either the selectedValue or the unselectedValue, otherwise an UnknownStateValueException will occur.

This model does not support null. While the underlying value holder may initially contain null, any setText or setSelected operation will force either the selectedValue or unselectedValue to be stored in the value holder. A null value in the value holder is treated as unselected by the isSelected and getText methods.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Marty Phelan
